metadata.scenario: Customer support interaction about a billing issue

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I'm calling about a charge on my latest bill. I was charged $75, but my plan is supposed to be $50. I'm really confused and frankly, a little annoyed.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hello, I understand your frustration. Thank you for reaching out. Could you please provide me with your account number or the phone number associated with your account so I can look into this for you?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you. One moment while I access your account... Okay, I see the charge. It appears there's a $25 data overage fee. Did you perhaps exceed your monthly data allowance?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Data overage? That's ridiculous! I've never gone over before. How much data did I supposedly use?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: According to our system, you used 2GB over your allocated amount this month. To help avoid this in the future, we can set up data usage alerts. Would you be interested in that?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Look, I'm still not convinced I used that much data. Is there any way to see a detailed breakdown of my data usage? Specifically, which apps used the most data?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: While I don't have access to app-specific data usage information, you can typically find that within your phone's settings. Check under "Data Usage" or "Mobile Data" in your settings menu. Regarding the charge, I can offer a one-time credit of $15 to help offset the overage fee as a gesture of goodwill.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, I guess that's something. I'll check my phone's settings. Thanks for the credit. Hopefully, this won't happen again.
